 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָקַב‎</span> **verb** ==follow at the heel==, figurative ==assail insidiously, circumvent, overreach== (denominative from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָקֵב‎</span>; compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***follow*** (at the heel), ***succeed***, III. ***bring consequence on***, i.e. ***punish***, Qor 22:59; IV. ***make to follow***, i.e. ***reward*** or ***punish***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***end, final lot*** 6:11 ***reward*** 6:136 <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***hold back*** (rare), ***follow***, Pa\`el ***investigate, search out:*** Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***keep, guard***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular [[Hos.12.4|Hos 12:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּבֶּטֶן עָקַב אֶתאָֿחִיו‎</span> he ***attacked*** his brother ***at the heel*** (compare [[Gen.25.26|Gen 25:26]] below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָקֵב‎</span>); ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular [[Gen.27.36|Gen 27:36]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲכִי קָרָא שְׁמוֺ יַעֲקֹב וַיַּעְקְבֵנִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה פַעֲמַיִם‎</span> and he hath ***overreached*** me now twice; + ***Infinitive abs*** [[Jer.9.3|Jer 9:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּלאָֿח עָקוֺב יַעֲקֹב‎</span> surely ***overreacheth*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָכִיל יַהֲלֹח‎</span>). [[[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">πτερνίζω</span>, to attack ***with*** the heel; but this dubious In 'supplant,' also, the figurative is a different one.] **Pi\`el** [[Job.37.4|Job 37:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלֹא יְעַקְּבֵם‎</span> dubious; poss ***attack at the heel*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זִנֵּב‎</span>), hence figurative ***hold back***; more probably read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלֹא‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְעַכְּבֵם‎</span> ***holdeth*** them not ***back*** (that is <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּרָקָיו‎</span> his lightnings), when his voice is heard from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִכֵּב‎</span> ***to hold back*** (common in Late Hebrew; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַכֵּב‎</span>).
